alert.note: Alert for Knott; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Letcher and southern Knott Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Crown, or over Whitesburg. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Crown and Polly around 635 PM EDT. Whitco and Ice around 640 PM EDT. Lester around 645 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Democrat, Bellcraft, Marlowe, Lucastown, Whitesburg, Dongola, Day, Southdown, Deane, Fleming-Neon, Colly, Ermine, Sergent, Mayking, Winters, Farraday, Millstone, Thornton and Craftsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
